column4: i have a microsoft usb wireless mouse taht has worked on every distro of linux i've tried so far.... but it doesn't work on kubuntu! lsusb shows it, and it's def not the port since it lights up (the receiver). also i can't find gpm? it says something refers to it but it has no candidates (apt-get install gpm)
- your apt-get problem sounds like you need to enable a repository - check you have the universe repository enabled

thanks for response. it IS only the install cd though. taht might be why. that's just a help, but not even a lil' bit required. i'd much rather know why this mouse isn't working. the device is set to /dev/input/mice in xorg.conf, the default; i see no reason this shouldn't work as it has on many other distros
- check you have the modules psmouse usbcore and uhci_hcd in your kernel modules list. check by typing lsmod in a terminal and searching through or grep them ie lsmod | grep psmouse etc
they are all loaded.
- type sudo cat /dev/input/mice and press return. move your mouse about and see if you get anything turn up on the screen
will do, thanks
nothing :(
- also check you have the module ehci_hcd loaded ie lsmod | grep ehci
i do
what i don't get... appears right in lsusb. the receiver obv. gets power, is lit up. mouse/receiver definitley work
- does you mouse work using the live cd?
this is the livecd. i'm trying to install it
maybe it's just this pc. maybe the board/usb port. it gets power, yes, but that doesn't mean data. when i say it works, even w/linux, it was never on this box before.
- ahh ok - sorry your problem has me beat - i have a wireless usb mouse on my system and that works fine.... fraid i've kinda run out of ideas on that one
- that may be the case :(
maybe another port... before i grab a new mouse/try w/same ubuntu cd on another box
- just a quick one - do you have usbmouse in the output of lsmod ie does lsmod | grep usbmouse show up? if not try sudo modprobe usbmouse
no, it was not loaded by default. seems to make no difference though.
- do you have usbhid module loaded too?
yes
- ok, well ...it was worth a go :)
thanks.
